meanings.definition: Of or relating to a zone.
meanings.sent1: The zonular markings on the map indicated different regions.
meanings.sent2: The zonular boundaries separated the city into districts.
meanings.sent3: The zonular division of the playground made it easy for the children to take turns.
meanings.sent4: Her zonular approach to organizing her closet helped her find things quickly.
meanings.sent5: The zonular classification of plants made it easier for botanists to study them.

meanings.sent1: The zonular pattern on the fabric looked like intersecting circles.
meanings.sent2: Her zonular hairstyle had alternating sections of color.
meanings.sent3: The zonular design on the cake made it look like a target.
meanings.sent4: The zonular arrangement of lights created a cozy atmosphere in the room.
meanings.sent5: The zonular color scheme of the room gave it a modern feel.

meanings.definition: A small, circular or oval area.
meanings.sent1: The garden had a zonular of flowers in the center.
meanings.sent2: She noticed a zonular of light peeking through the curtains.
meanings.sent3: The zonular of frosting on the cupcake was the perfect amount.
meanings.sent4: The lake had a zonular of calm water surrounded by ripples.
meanings.sent5: The zonular of silence in the room made her feel peaceful.
